metadata.title: CVE-2020-35653 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In Pillow before 8.1.0, PcxDecode has a buffer over-read when decoding acrafted PCX file because the user-supplied stride value is trusted forbuffer calculations.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-35653` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python3-pil - 7.0.0-4ubuntu0.2
python3-pil.imagetk - 7.0.0-4ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pillow package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.0.0-4ubuntu0.2').
pillow-python2 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
